fullText: The script can drag and the metaphors pile higher that Jenga blocks, but the oblique text of “Grey House” never lacks for intrigue and edge-of-your-seat fascination. And the show’s fine cast and creatives do their best to make it all less impenetrable.

keyPhrases.quote: The script can drag and the metaphors pile higher that Jenga blocks
never lacks for intrigue and edge-of-your-seat fascination
the show's fine cast and creatives do their best to make it all less impenetrable

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Mixed review that acknowledges significant script problems but praises the cast and finds the show intriguing despite its flaws.
